meanings.definition: Before a code or regulation is in effect.
meanings.sent1: She completed the project precode, ensuring everything was ready before the deadline.
meanings.sent2: The team always double-checks their work precode to avoid any errors.
meanings.sent3: The students joked that they were so efficient, they finished precode and had time for a coffee break.
meanings.sent4: His meticulous planning precode saved the company from a potential disaster.
meanings.sent5: The early birds arrived precode, eager to start the day.

meanings.definition: To prepare for coding or regulation.
meanings.sent1: They precode the software to ensure it runs smoothly.
meanings.sent2: Remember to precode your work before submitting it for review.
meanings.sent3: The chef likes to precode his ingredients before starting to cook.
meanings.sent4: She decided to precode her schedule for the week to stay organized.
meanings.sent5: The team will precode the presentation to avoid any last-minute issues.

meanings.definition: A code or regulation that has not yet been implemented.
meanings.sent1: The precode was approved but will only come into effect next month.
meanings.sent2: The company is reviewing the precode before finalizing it.
meanings.sent3: The precode caused some confusion among the employees.
meanings.sent4: He studied the precode carefully to understand its implications.
meanings.sent5: The precode is essential for maintaining safety standards in the workplace.
